thread.title: Blind Date to return to TV - but who will replace Cilla Black?
thread.title_full: Blind Date to return to TV - but who will replace Cilla Black?

author: Yahoo Celebrity UK
title: Blind Date to return to TV - but who will replace Cilla Black?
text:
‘Blind Date’ proved a hit with viewers for years until the one and only Cilla Black announced she was quitting live on air back in 2003.
View photos
Blind Date ran from 1983 – 2003 and was hosted by the late Cilla Black More Now the beloved dating show – which ran for almost two decades – is getting a reboot thanks to Channel 5 buying up the rights and it’s set to be a “sexy, modern and young” affair.
A source told The Sun online: “‘Blind Date’ is the original dating show and it’s huge news to bring it back.
“It’s a classic format that will be rebooted to make it young, sexy and modern. Expect sparks to fly. In an age of Tinder, you have got to earn the right to love on this show.”
View photos
The programme sees three singletons grilled by a member of the opposite sex in order to find the perfect match without being able to see them. The new couple then pick an envelope with their holiday destination – abroad or in the UK – inside and will spend the next week trying to get to know one another.
It’s not known who will replace Cilla, who tragically passed away in 2015, as the host.
However, Vicky Pattison, Olly Murs, Georgia May Foote and Helen Flanagan are among those in talks about taking over as the presenter of the dating series.
View photos
Bosses are keen to keep some of the “traditional” elements of the previous run but have decided to give it an updated twist to appeal to a “new generation of viewers”.
It’s expected to run on Friday nights – rather than its traditional Saturday night slot – and will consist of six to eight episodes per series for the first few installments.
